casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Radhwan AL-HAMOOD No. 142P19 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2019 James R. Parish, Attorney at Law, Fayetteville, for Al-Hamood, Radhwan. Daniel P. O'Brien, Special Deputy Attorney General. Patrick M. Megaro, Attorney at Law, for Al-Hamood, Radhwan. Ann W. Matthews, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. Anne M. Middleton, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. N. Lorrin Freeman, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 23rd of April 2019 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2019."

Davis, J. recused
